parameters: In this demo, I will show you all the features
to the left you find a test of all configuration options
you have for the image displays.\.
on the right are tests for all available plugin commands.
in front of you are examples of show text commands
and at the bottom are some examples of what you can achieve
depending of the selected scaling method
config: scaling:none, x:0.05, y:0.05, width:0.9, height:0.9
depending of the selected scaling method
config: scaling:fill, x:0.05, y:0.05, width:0.9, height:0.9
alignment has no effect on fill, because the display
depending of the selected scaling method
config: scaling:contain, x:0.05, y:0.05, width:0.9, height:0.9
depending of the selected scaling method
config: scaling:contain, x:0.4, y:0.05, width:0.2, height:0.9
depending of the selected scaling method
config: scaling:cover, x:0.05, y:0.05, width:0.9, height:0.9
config: scaling:fill, x:0.05, y:0.05, width:0.9, height:0.9
alignment has no effect on fill, because the display
you can also change the position of the message window
you can also create configs with tiled sprites if you want
to put multiple iamges in one file.
i will show you all available plugin commands.
first, lets select a container source.
and create our first display by loading an existing one by name
this container is behind most elements, but get automaticly
(display config charClose is loaded and image body1 and face_normal are set)
this container gets added to the message window.
its in front of the window frame but behind the text.
this container is only visible when a text is shown
when the message window gets shown again.
this container gets added to the message window.
its in front of the window frame and in front of the text.
this container is only visible when a text is shown
for the next command move to the right
in the first example i showed you how to select and create image displays
for this example lest look at commands which allow us to alter existing displays.
but first lets create a new config and load 3 images
ok now lets move the display
i think the image is to small, lets increase the size
but first set the pivot to 0.5, 0.5 to rotate around the center
now change some of the sub images
who likes pixelart, lets change the scaling method to inerpolation
i think this image needs a little bit more red.
sometimes you need to hide or show images
and when you'r done you can remove the display.
or if you want everything gone you can call clear all displays
in the next example i will show you how you can do most of the things
i shown you now in one command
with the set images extended command you can
load a config, set images, flip,opacity and change the colortone all
now you know most commands, feel free to experiment and try
what you can do for yourself
sometimes you want to change display between sentences but in one message.
this can be achieved with message commands.
let me show you what you can do
first lets create a new display and show a simple image
.\..\..\.\B[0,char1,0:body1:1:face_normal]\..\..\.. you see we now have a display
you can also create multiple displays
not every command is available in messages, but most are
dont forget that you can also customize the message window itself \B[0,char1,0:body1:1:face_normal]\B[S0,0.3,1]
\. lets move the image in position \..\..\.. \B[S0,0.4,1.5]\B[M0,0.1,0.3]
\B[0,charClose,0:body1:1:face_normal]hello adventurer, what brings you here at this late hour
\B[0,,,,150]\B[1,charClose,,true]\B[T1,0.9,0.1]\B[1,charClose,0:body2:1:face_normal]i'm on a quest to find the lost art of displayling images on a screen
\B[1,,,,150]\B[0,,,,255]are you supid ?\B[0,,1:face_angry] there are no images here.
you can even use the plugin in battles
how many displays do you want?
